intro: Struthanthus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and clusters of small, pale yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Struthanthus micranthus is adapted to arid environments, showcasing features that aid in water conservation and survival in harsh conditions.
